title: Security Policy
text: believe found security vulnerability repositories organization, please report us coordinated disclosure. Please report security vulnerabilities public GitHub issues, discussions, pull requests. Instead, please send email vulnerability.management[@]roche.com. Please include much information listed can help us better understand resolve issue: type issue (e.g., buffer overflow, SQL injection, cross-site scripting) Full paths source file(s) related manifestation issue location affected source code (tag/branch/commit direct URL) special configuration required reproduce issue Step--step instructions reproduce issue Proof--concept exploit code (possible) Impact issue, including attacker might exploit issue information help us triage report quickly.

title: Security Policy

title: Join Keys
text: teal.data gives possibility define individual keys per dataset define relations datasets. table can set keys inform structure relation tables specifying: columns consisting primary key merge keys, concept similar SQL‚Äôs foreign key. Usually, application developer needs specify keys manually, case datasets named according ADaM standard, teal can assign keys . Refer vignette("including-adam-data--teal", package = "teal") information.

title: Join Keys
text: Using keys argument dataset function (DDL dataset_connector), can specify column(s) dataset (together) uniquely identify rows dataset.
code: library(teal.data) library(dplyr)  iris_with_keys <- mutate(iris, id = factor(row_number()))  ds <- dataset(   "IRIS",   iris_with_keys,   code = "IRIS <- iris %>% mutate(id = factor(row_number()))",   keys = c("id") )  ds$get_keys() ## [1] "id"

title: Join Keys
text: passing multiple datasets cdisc_data function, dataset relationship set using join_keys join_key used merge datasets together within teal apps. users familiar SQL database schema, relationships symmetric strict SQL foreign key relationships teal validate whether values inserted foreign key columns present parent table. example: join_keys function used specify keys: join_keys collection multiple join_key entries dataset_1, dataset_2 - name two datasets key - (optionally) named vector column names Note assumed join keys symmetric, .e.¬†join_key("x", "y", "x_col" = "y_col") enable merge ‚Äúx‚Äù ‚Äúy‚Äù vice versa.
code: library(teal.data)  data_1 <- data.frame(X = factor(1:10), Y = 21:30, Z = 1:10) data_2 <- data.frame(W = factor(10:1), V = factor(5:14), M = rep(1:5, 2)) data_3 <- data.frame(V = factor(5:14), T = 4)  data <- teal_data(   dataset("D1", data_1, code = "D1 <- data.frame(X = factor(1:10), Y = 21:30, Z = 1:10)"),   dataset("D2", data_2, code = "D2 <- data.frame(W = factor(10:1), V = factor(5:14), M = rep(1:5, 2))"),   dataset("D3", data_3, code = "D3 <- data.frame(V = factor(5:14), T = 4)"),   join_keys = join_keys(     join_key("D1", "D2", c("X" = "W")),     join_key("D2", "D3", c("V" = "V"))   ) )

title: Migrate your TealData into teal_data
text: teal-app-developer creates TealDataset object using functions teal.data::dataset() teal.data::cdisc_dataset(), encapsulate data code, along metadata. object subsequently used create TealData object functions teal.data::teal_data() teal.data::cdisc_data(), capable accommodating multiple TealDataset objects. TealData object passed teal::init(), processed tdata object. tdata object made available across modules teal-module-developer access use within teal modules.

title: Migrate your TealData into teal_data
code: # Deprecated way of using data.frame into teal::init() app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(     teal.data::dataset(dataname = "IRIS", x = iris, code = "IRIS <- iris"),     teal.data::dataset(dataname = "MTCARS", x = mtcars, code = "MTCARS <- mtcars")   ),   modules = teal.modules.general::tm_variable_browser() ) shiny::shinyApp(app$ui, app$server)  # Deprecated way of using CDISC data.frame into teal::init() ADSL <- scda::synthetic_cdisc_data("latest")$adsl ADTTE <- scda::synthetic_cdisc_data("latest")$adtte app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::cdisc_data(     teal.data::cdisc_dataset(       dataname = "ADSL", x = ADSL,       code = "ADSL <- scda::synthetic_cdisc_data('latest')$adsl"     ),     teal.data::cdisc_dataset(       dataname = "ADTTE", x = ADTTE,       code = "ADTTE <- scda::synthetic_cdisc_data('latest')$adtte"     )   ),   modules = teal.modules.general::tm_variable_browser() ) shiny::shinyApp(app$ui, app$server)  # Deprecated way of using MultiAssayExperiment into teal::init() MAE <- hermes::multi_assay_experiment app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(     teal.data::dataset(dataname = "MAE", x = MAE, code = "MAE <- hermes::multi_assay_experiment")   ),   modules = teal.modules.hermes::tm_g_scatterplot(label = "scatterplot", mae_name = "MAE") ) shiny::shinyApp(app$ui, app$server)

title: Migrate your TealData into teal_data
text: Now, teal-app-developer needs use one teal_data generator functions: teal.data::teal_data() teal.data::cdisc_data(). functions extended accept multiple data objects. teal_data object passed teal::init(), processed tdata object. tdata object made available across modules teal-module-developer access use within teal modules.

title: Migrate your TealData into teal_data
code: # Current way of using data.frame into teal::init() app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(     IRIS = iris,     MTCARS = mtcars,     code = "       IRIS <- iris       MTCARS <- mtcars     "   ),   modules = teal.modules.general::tm_variable_browser() ) shiny::shinyApp(app$ui, app$server)  # Current way of using CDISC data.frame into teal::init() ADSL <- scda::synthetic_cdisc_data("latest")$adsl ADTTE <- scda::synthetic_cdisc_data("latest")$adtte app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(     ADSL = ADSL,     ADTTE = ADTTE,     code = "       ADSL <- scda::synthetic_cdisc_data('latest')$adsl       ADTTE <- scda::synthetic_cdisc_data('latest')$adtte     "   ),   modules = teal.modules.general::tm_variable_browser() ) shiny::shinyApp(app$ui, app$server)  # Current way of using MultiAssayExperiment into teal::init() MAE <- hermes::multi_assay_experiment app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(     MAE = MAE,     code = "MAE <- hermes::multi_assay_experiment"   ),   modules = teal.modules.hermes::tm_g_scatterplot(label = "scatterplot", mae_name = "MAE") ) shiny::shinyApp(app$ui, app$server)

title: Pre-processing Delayed Data
text: may required generate delayed data object dependent delayed object constant value. , creating delayed data object ‚Äôs possible supply additional variables accessed data loading (pull) using additional arguments ...: ‚Äôs also possible supply additional variables creating object using mutate_dataset function. also required creating object depends another delayed data object: possible provide code Data level. However, always return code used generate datasets object: better approach supply code Dataset level. ensures code accessed dataset level contains snippets pertains : Related idea, delayed data object needs supplied code needed reproduce data. can provided Dataset level Data level. comparison two approaches:
code:
get_code(adsl) ## [1] "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL")
ADSL$SEX <- as.factor(ADSL$SEX)" pull_fun_adae <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADAE")) adae <- dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADAE",   pull_callable = pull_fun_adae,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADAE") )  get_code(adae) ## [1] "ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADAE")" last_run <- Sys.Date() # constant value stored as a variable in the current session  adsl_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")) adsl <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = adsl_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL") ) %>%   mutate_dataset("ADSL$last_run <- last_run", vars = list(last_run = last_run))  cat(get_code(adsl)) ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") ## last_run <- structure(19653, class = "Date") ## ADSL$last_run <- last_run # compared to evaluating the variable at the time of loading adsl_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")) adsl <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = adsl_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL") ) %>%   mutate_dataset("last_run <- Sys.Date()
ADSL$last_run <- last_run")  adsl %>%   get_code() %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") ## last_run <- Sys.Date() ## ADSL$last_run <- last_run adsl <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL") adae_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADAE")) adae <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADAE",   pull_callable = adae_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADAE") ) %>%   mutate_dataset("ADAE$n <- nrow(ADSL)")  cat(get_code(adae)) # the code returned by `adae` is not sufficient to reproduce `adae` ## ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADAE") ## ADAE$n <- nrow(ADSL) adsl_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")) adsl <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = adsl_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL") ) adae_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADAE")) adae <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADAE",   pull_callable = adae_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADAE") ) %>%   mutate_dataset("ADAE$n <- nrow(ADSL)", vars = list(ADSL = adsl))  cat(get_code(adae)) # this code can be run independently ## ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADAE") ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") ## ADAE$n <- nrow(ADSL) adsl_adae <- cdisc_data(   adsl,   adae ) %>% mutate_data("ADAE$avg_age <- mean(ADAE$AGE)")  # the output for all 3 are the same adsl_adae %>%   get_code() %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") ## ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADAE") ## ADAE$n <- nrow(ADSL) ## ADAE$avg_age <- mean(ADAE$AGE) adsl_adae %>%   get_code(dataname = "ADAE") %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") ## ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADAE") ## ADAE$n <- nrow(ADSL) ## ADAE$avg_age <- mean(ADAE$AGE) adsl_adae %>%   get_code(dataname = "ADSL") %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") ## ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADAE") ## ADAE$n <- nrow(ADSL) ## ADAE$avg_age <- mean(ADAE$AGE) adsl_adae <- cdisc_data(   adsl,   adae %>% mutate_dataset("ADAE$avg_age <- mean(ADAE$AGE)") )  adsl_adae %>%   get_code() %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") ## ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADAE") ## ADAE$n <- nrow(ADSL) ## ADAE$avg_age <- mean(ADAE$AGE) adsl_adae %>%   get_code("ADAE") %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") ## ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADAE") ## ADAE$n <- nrow(ADSL) ## ADAE$avg_age <- mean(ADAE$AGE) adsl_adae %>%   get_code("ADSL") %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") adsl <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL")  # no reproducible code provided cdisc_dataset("ADSL", adsl) %>%   get_code() %>%   cat()  # provide the code to reproduce the data: cdisc_dataset("ADSL", adsl,   code = "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL")" ) %>%   get_code() ## [1] "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL")" # it's possible to supply the code at the `Data` level: adae <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADAE") adsl_adae <- cdisc_data(   cdisc_dataset("ADSL", adsl),   cdisc_dataset("ADAE", adae),   code = "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL")
ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADAE")" )  adsl_adae %>%   get_code() %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL") ## ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADAE") # but it's not possible then to access the code at a `Dataset` level: adsl_adae %>%   get_code("ADSL") %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL") ## ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADAE") # this can be avoided by storing the code like so: adsl_adae <- cdisc_data(   cdisc_dataset("ADSL", adsl, code = "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL")"),   cdisc_dataset("ADAE", adae, code = "ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADAE")") )  adsl_adae %>%   get_code("ADSL") %>%   cat() ## ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL")

title: Reproducibility check
text: teal.data classes accumulate raw data accept boolean check argument, e.g.¬†teal_data. boolean flag indicates whether teal performs validation data passed TealData object launch teal application. validation compares raw data passed class dataset returned code stored class. E.g.: check() method called launch can invoked directly returns TRUE raw data passed teal_data matches return value code stored class. returns error comparison fails NULL check = FALSE passed teal_data. Find teal_data() documentation.
code: library(teal.data) iris_ds <- dataset("iris", iris, code = "iris <- iris") data <- teal_data(iris_ds, check = TRUE) ## Warning: The `data_objects` argument of `cdisc_data()` should use data directly. Using ## TealDatasetConnector and TealDataset is deprecated. as of teal.data 0.3.1. ## This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. ## Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was ## generated. data$check() ## [1] TRUE # throws an error: data <- teal_data(dataset("iris", iris, code = "iris <- mtcars"), check = TRUE) ## Error in x$check_reproducibility(): Reproducibility check failed. data <- teal_data(dataset("iris", iris, code = "iris <- mtcars"), check = FALSE)  # returns NULL even though the code does not match the raw data data$check() ## NULL

title: teal.data with Python
text: possible use Python code (via reticulate package) create teal dataset. python_dataset_connector allows seamless integration teal application Python package(s) required access/create data. recommend thorough understanding reticulate package (see ) using Python functionality described .

title: teal.data with Python
text: section show simple example Python code can used create teal dataset. example require Python environment pandas installed. See details install Python packages. first load packages: Next define Python code want use create dataset. example, demonstration purposes create trivial dataset easily done directly R. Note use variable num_rows needs passed Python code R. Next create python_dataset_connector object. Finally can test code pulling data R:
code: library(reticulate) # may need to be installed if not available # reticulate function to call to install the pandas package if not installed: py_install("pandas") library(teal.data) python_code <- "import pandas as pd data = pd.DataFrame({\"id\" : range(r.num_rows), \"val\" : range(r.num_rows)})" x <- python_dataset_connector(   dataname = "DATA", # the teal dataset name   code = python_code, # the code used to generate the dataset   object = "data", # the object in the Python code to be converted to a data.frame for the teal dataset   keys = "id", # the key for teal dataset object   vars = list(num_rows = 5L) # any variables passed from R into Python (note this could be an R variable) ) x$pull() print(x)

title: Examining Delayed Data Objects
text: delayed data object created described Delayed Data Objects, teal.data provides useful set functions examine object outside shiny application, .e. global environment. exhaustive list functions: basic function get_dataname returns name dataset datasets delayed data object: delayed data objects described also contain launch method can used test data loading screen: also pull method test data can loaded without launching shiny app. See Delayed Data Advanced. Alternatively teal.data provides load_dataset function <...>Dataset<...> objects used pull data without launching delayed loading screen, load_datasetsfunction <...>Data<...> objects launches delayed loading screen used pull datasets connection. loading data, can checked data successfully pulled using is_pulled function:
code: library(teal.data) library(magrittr)  adsl_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")) adsl <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = adsl_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL") ) get_dataname(adsl) # "ADSL" ## [1] "ADSL" adae_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADAE")) adae <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADAE",   pull_callable = adae_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADAE") ) delayed_data <- cdisc_data(adsl, adae) ## Warning: The `data_objects` argument of `cdisc_data()` should use data directly. Using ## TealDatasetConnector and TealDataset is deprecated. as of teal.data 0.3.1. ## This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. ## Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was ## generated. get_dataname(delayed_data) # "ADSL" "ADAE" ## [1] "ADSL" "ADAE" if (interactive()) {   delayed_data$launch() } if (interactive()) {   load_datasets(delayed_data) } is_pulled(delayed_data) ## [1] FALSE

title: Creating Delayed Data Classes (Advanced)
text: following general descriptions main classes teal.data package. TealDataset contains physical data form single data.frame plus reproducible code. TealDatasetConnector contains instructions obtain single TealDataset object. TealDataConnection opens closes connections (remote data sources). TealDataConnector contains arbitrary many TealDatasetConnector objects optionally one TealDataConnection object. TealData contains arbitrary many TealDataset, TealDatasetConnector / TealDataConnector objects. exception TealDataConnection, classes CDISC equivalent, e.g.¬†TealData -> CDISCTealData.

title: Creating Delayed Data Classes (Advanced)
text: simpler version Callable class CallableCode. Similar CallableFunction, CallableCode stores code can evaluated using run() isn‚Äôt able use dynamic arguments make code general. CallableCode also allows assignment objects environment. CallableCode can contain multiple lines (commands) code also allows library calls. Please note objects assigned independent environment can‚Äôt modified locked immediately. means CallableCode created allowed make changes x1.
code: code <- callable_code(   "library(teal.data)   ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(\"ADTTE\")   ADTTE$x1 <- x1   ADTTE <- dplyr::filter(ADTTE, PARAMCD %in% c('EFS', 'OS'))" )  # examine call cat(code$get_call()) #> library(teal.data) #> ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADTTE") #> ADTTE$x1 <- x1 #> ADTTE <- dplyr::filter(ADTTE, PARAMCD %in% c("EFS", "OS"))  # assign x1 to environment (otherwise code would run with error as x1 would not be defined) code$assign_to_env("x1", 1)  # evaluate call df <- code$run() head(df$x1, 2) #> [1] 1 1

what: TealDataset (base class which CDISCTealDataset inherits from)
title: Creating Delayed Data Classes (Advanced)
text: TealDataset R6 class keeps data.frame raw_data slot. One can create TealDataset including data.frame setting data attributes. example first create adsl put data.frame cdisc_dataset function. Together data.frame one also provide dataname optional code reproduce data reproducibility required. Note cdisc_dataset returns object CDISCTealDataset, needed CDISC analysis. object created contains previously defined attributes can extracted.
code: library(magrittr)  adsl_raw <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL") %>% head(3)  adsl_dataset <- cdisc_dataset(   dataname = "ADSL",   x = adsl_raw,   code = "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(\"ADSL\") %>% head(3)" ) # check if code is reproducible get_dataname(adsl_dataset) #> [1] "ADSL"  # get label get_dataset_label(adsl_dataset) #> [1] "Subject Level Analysis Dataset"  # get reproducible code get_code(adsl_dataset) #> [1] "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(\"ADSL\") %>% head(3)"  # get data.frame get_raw_data(adsl_dataset) #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 55 #>   STUDYID USUBJID     SUBJID SITEID   AGE AGEU  SEX   RACE  ETHNIC COUNTRY DTHFL #>   <chr>   <chr>       <chr>  <chr>  <int> <fct> <fct> <fct> <fct>  <fct>   <fct> #> 1 AB12345 AB12345-CH‚Ä¶ id-128 CHN-3     32 YEARS M     ASIAN HISPA‚Ä¶ CHN     Y     #> 2 AB12345 AB12345-CH‚Ä¶ id-262 CHN-15    35 YEARS M     BLAC‚Ä¶ NOT H‚Ä¶ CHN     N     #> 3 AB12345 AB12345-RU‚Ä¶ id-378 RUS-3     30 YEARS F     ASIAN NOT H‚Ä¶ RUS     N     #> # ‚Ñπ 44 more variables: INVID <chr>, INVNAM <chr>, ARM <fct>, ARMCD <fct>, #> #   ACTARM <fct>, ACTARMCD <fct>, TRT01P <fct>, TRT01A <fct>, TRT02P <fct>, #> #   TRT02A <fct>, REGION1 <fct>, STRATA1 <fct>, STRATA2 <fct>, BMRKR1 <dbl>, #> #   BMRKR2 <fct>, ITTFL <fct>, SAFFL <fct>, BMEASIFL <fct>, BEP01FL <fct>, #> #   AEWITHFL <fct>, RANDDT <date>, TRTSDTM <dttm>, TRTEDTM <dttm>, #> #   TRT01SDTM <dttm>, TRT01EDTM <dttm>, TRT02SDTM <dttm>, TRT02EDTM <dttm>, #> #   AP01SDTM <dttm>, AP01EDTM <dttm>, AP02SDTM <dttm>, AP02EDTM <dttm>, ‚Ä¶  # get keys (i.e. the primary keys of the dataset) adsl_dataset$get_keys() #> [1] "STUDYID" "USUBJID"

what: TealDatasetConnector (base class which CDISCTealDatasetConnector inherits from)
title: Creating Delayed Data Classes (Advanced)
text: TealDatasetConnector contains Callable object obtain single TealDataset object. code chunk , connector created based example_cdisc_data function. Initially, adsl_conn doesn‚Äôt contain data. Attempting fetch unavailable data produce error. Data can loaded using load_dataset() function. data loaded, adsl_conn contains reproducible code also code pull data. TealDatasetConnector also allows variables passed Callable object may depend . code adsl_raw object - created - added CallableFunction. properly link ADSL argument function inside CallableFunction object raw data adsl_raw several parameters match: .name("dummy_name") must value name "ADSL" - set_args(list(ADSL = .name("dummy_name"))) dummy_name must linked raw data adsl_raw - vars = list(dummy_name = adsl_raw) name ADSL fixed name argument function inside CallableFunction. name dummy_name free valid R name. TealDatasetConnector like delayed data objects contains launch method can used obtain data using shiny application. function can used check objects specified correctly investigate potential mistakes. default shiny app won‚Äôt render inputs datasets specify . set inputs use $set_ui_input(), passing UI module function, ns argument (shiny namespace ID object). example , callable_function object contains two arguments, ADSL n. ADSL given n entered shiny app launch method called.
code: adsl_conn <- dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%     set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   label = "Subject-Level Analysis Dataset" ) # get raw data try(get_raw_data(adsl_conn)) #> Error : 'ADSL' has not been pulled yet #>  - please use `load_dataset()` first. # execution/reproducible code get_code(adsl_conn) #> [1] "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = \"ADSL\")"  # pull data load_dataset(adsl_conn)  # get raw data get_raw_data(adsl_conn) #> # A tibble: 400 √ó 55 #>    STUDYID USUBJID    SUBJID SITEID   AGE AGEU  SEX   RACE  ETHNIC COUNTRY DTHFL #>    <chr>   <chr>      <chr>  <chr>  <int> <fct> <fct> <fct> <fct>  <fct>   <fct> #>  1 AB12345 AB12345-C‚Ä¶ id-128 CHN-3     32 YEARS M     ASIAN HISPA‚Ä¶ CHN     Y     #>  2 AB12345 AB12345-C‚Ä¶ id-262 CHN-15    35 YEARS M     BLAC‚Ä¶ NOT H‚Ä¶ CHN     N     #>  3 AB12345 AB12345-R‚Ä¶ id-378 RUS-3     30 YEARS F     ASIAN NOT H‚Ä¶ RUS     N     #>  4 AB12345 AB12345-C‚Ä¶ id-220 CHN-11    26 YEARS F     ASIAN NOT H‚Ä¶ CHN     N     #>  5 AB12345 AB12345-C‚Ä¶ id-267 CHN-7     40 YEARS M     ASIAN NOT H‚Ä¶ CHN     N     #>  6 AB12345 AB12345-C‚Ä¶ id-201 CHN-15    49 YEARS M     ASIAN NOT H‚Ä¶ CHN     Y     #>  7 AB12345 AB12345-U‚Ä¶ id-45  USA-1     34 YEARS F     ASIAN NOT H‚Ä¶ USA     N     #>  8 AB12345 AB12345-U‚Ä¶ id-261 USA-1     32 YEARS F     ASIAN NOT H‚Ä¶ USA     N     #>  9 AB12345 AB12345-N‚Ä¶ id-173 NGA-11    24 YEARS F     BLAC‚Ä¶ NOT H‚Ä¶ NGA     N     #> 10 AB12345 AB12345-C‚Ä¶ id-307 CHN-1     24 YEARS M     ASIAN NOT H‚Ä¶ CHN     Y     #> # ‚Ñπ 390 more rows #> # ‚Ñπ 44 more variables: INVID <chr>, INVNAM <chr>, ARM <fct>, ARMCD <fct>, #> #   ACTARM <fct>, ACTARMCD <fct>, TRT01P <fct>, TRT01A <fct>, TRT02P <fct>, #> #   TRT02A <fct>, REGION1 <fct>, STRATA1 <fct>, STRATA2 <fct>, BMRKR1 <dbl>, #> #   BMRKR2 <fct>, ITTFL <fct>, SAFFL <fct>, BMEASIFL <fct>, BEP01FL <fct>, #> #   AEWITHFL <fct>, RANDDT <date>, TRTSDTM <dttm>, TRTEDTM <dttm>, #> #   TRT01SDTM <dttm>, TRT01EDTM <dttm>, TRT02SDTM <dttm>, TRT02EDTM <dttm>, ‚Ä¶ # here we use the general dataset_connector function which pulls an object of type TealDataset # there is also a cdisc_dataset_connector function which pulls an object of type CDISCTealDataset adsl_2 <- dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL_2",   pull_callable = callable_function(fun = function(ADSL) ADSL_2 <- ADSL) %>% # nolint     set_args(list(ADSL = as.name("dummy_name"))),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   label = "Example label",   vars = list(dummy_name = adsl_raw) )  load_dataset(adsl_2) adsl_3 <- dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL_3",   pull_callable = callable_function(fun = function(ADSL, n) ADSL_3 <- head(ADSL, n)) %>% # nolint     set_args(list(ADSL = as.name("ADSL"))),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   label = "Example label",   vars = list(ADSL = adsl_raw) )  adsl_3$set_ui_input(function(ns) {   list(     numericInput(inputId = ns("n"), label = "Choose number of records", min = 0, value = 1)   ) })  if (interactive()) {   adsl_3$launch() }

title: Creating Delayed Data Classes (Advanced)
text: Objects class responsible set connection remote data sources. TealDataConnection opens closes connections calling CallableFunction appropriate arguments. Note app pulls data remote source, outputs change even code data remote source changes. shiny applications, connection arguments need linked inputs, TealDataConnection contains module. Developers can customize UI inputs open connection using set_open_ui() specify relevant server function using set_open_server(). ‚Äôs important keep mind server module needs connection argument open() close() needed.
code: open_fun <- callable_function(data.frame) # define opening function open_fun$set_args(list(x = 1:5)) # define fixed arguments to opening function  close_fun <- callable_function(sum) # define closing function close_fun$set_args(list(x = 1:5)) # define fixed arguments to closing function  ping_fun <- callable_function(function() TRUE)  x <- data_connection(   ping_fun = ping_fun, # define ping function   open_fun = open_fun, # define opening function   close_fun = close_fun # define closing function )

what: TealDataConnector (base class which CDISCTealDataConnector inherits from)
title: Creating Delayed Data Classes (Advanced)
text: class combines multiple TealDatasetConnector (CDISCTealDatasetConnector) single TealDataConnection object. creates module manage connection load data. create two TealDatasetConnector objects TealDataConnection object combine together TealDataConnector object. object created can used pull data obtain code. combines code pull datasets preceded open connection code followed close connection code. Please note TealDataConnector doesn‚Äôt limit kind connectors set within, one must aware rather contain similar connectors (.e.¬†calling functions share arguments). example, execute data$set_pull_args(args = list(n = 5)), argument set connectors. case connector contains CallableFunction doesn‚Äôt n formals fail. CallableCode can‚Äôt hold additional arguments ‚Äôs fixed ignore every arguments set set_pull_args. default TealDataConnector creates simple shiny module without inputs arguments callable_function connectors. means , opening, closing, pulling datasets done default arguments. However, users can easily extend module using set_ui() set_server() specify UI server function . general rule creating modules callback server UI possible, server module executed submit button clicked. see set_preopen_server TealDataConnection object slight relaxation rule. extend app interface adding text input passed scda function. UI created conn connectors object server module requires connectors connection objects additional arguments. Executing data$launch() open shiny application prompts user input load data. Remember data can loaded . run code data$pull() please reinitialize connectors, connection data object running code .
code: # create TealDatasetConnectors slice_example_cdisc_data <- function(dataname, n) {   teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname) %>%     head(n) }  adsl <- dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = callable_function(slice_example_cdisc_data) %>%     set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   label = "Subject-Level Analysis Dataset" )  adsl_3 <- dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL_3",   pull_callable = callable_function(fun = function(ADSL, n = 5) { # nolint     ADSL_3 <- head(ADSL, n) # nolint   }) %>%     set_args(list(ADSL = as.name("ADSL"))),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   label = "Example label",   vars = list(ADSL = adsl) )  adsl_3$set_ui_input(function(ns) {   list(     numericInput(inputId = ns("n"), label = "Choose number of records", min = 0, value = 1)   ) })  connectors <- list(adsl, adsl_3)  # create connection open_fun <- callable_function(fun = library) open_fun$set_args(list(package = "teal.data")) conn <- teal.data:::TealDataConnection$new(open_fun = open_fun) # nolint  # create TealDataConnector data <- teal.data:::TealDataConnector$new(   connection = conn,   connectors = connectors ) cat(get_code(data)) #> library(package = "teal.data") #> ADSL <- (function(dataname, n) { #>     teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname) %>% head(n) #> })(dataname = "ADSL") #> ADSL_3 <- (function(ADSL, n = 5) { #>     ADSL_3 <- head(ADSL, n) #> })(ADSL = ADSL)  # pull ADSL and ADSL_3 data$set_pull_args(args = list(n = 5)) data$pull() data$set_ui(   function(id, ...) {     ns <- NS(id)     tagList(       conn$get_open_ui(ns("open_connection")),       textInput(ns("name"), p("Choose", code("name")), value = "latest"),       do.call(         what = "tagList",         args = lapply(           connectors,           function(connector) {             div(               connector$get_ui(                 id = ns(connector$get_dataname())               ),               br()             )           }         )       )     )   } )  data$set_server(   function(id, connection, connectors) {     moduleServer(       id = id,       module = function(input, output, session) {         # opens connection         if (!is.null(connection$get_open_server())) {           connection$get_open_server()(             id = "open_connection",             connection = connection           )         }         for (connector in connectors) {           # set_args before to return them in the code (fixed args)           set_args(connector, args = list(n = input$n))           # pull each dataset           connector$get_server()(id = connector$get_dataname())           if (connector$is_failed()) {             break           }         }       }     )   } ) if (interactive()) {   data$launch() }

what: TealData (base class which CDISCTealData inherits from)
title: Creating Delayed Data Classes (Advanced)
text: TealData manages TealDataset, TealDatasetConnector / TealDataConnector objects. CDISCTealData equivalent object creating apps analyze CDISC data. objects created using teal_data cdisc_data respectively. using teal package objects passed data argument init. One can combine multiple delayed data objects using [teal|cdisc]_data functions include shiny application. TealData gathers objects sets combined UI shiny inputs objects. code chunk specified four dataset connectors, works arbitrary many objects combination classes TealDataset, TealDatasetConnector / TealDataConnector. TealData also contains launch() method investigate data set correctly. However, TealData lacks pull() method. Reproducible code attached data object combined code components, one can also extract code single dataset specifying dataname argument. Developers can also extract datasets connectors included TealData.
code:
data <- cdisc_data(   cdisc_dataset(     dataname = "ADSL",     teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL"),     code = "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL")"   ),   cdisc_dataset(     dataname = "ADTTE",     teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADTTE"),     code = "ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADTTE")"   ) ) #> Warning: The `data_objects` argument of `cdisc_data()` should use data directly. Using #> TealDatasetConnector and TealDataset is deprecated. as of teal.data 0.3.1. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. # nolint start example_cdisc_dataset_connector <- function(dataname) {   cdisc_dataset_connector(     dataname = dataname,     pull_callable = callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%       set_args(list(dataname = dataname)),     keys = get_cdisc_keys(dataname),     label = sprintf("%s connector", dataname)   ) } adsl <- example_cdisc_dataset_connector("ADSL") adae <- example_cdisc_dataset_connector("ADAE") advs <- example_cdisc_dataset_connector("ADVS") adtte <- example_cdisc_dataset_connector("ADTTE")  data <- cdisc_data(adsl, adae, advs, adtte) # nolint end if (interactive()) {   data$launch() } get_code(data) #> [1] "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL")
ADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADAE")
ADVS <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADVS")
ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADTTE")" get_code(data, dataname = "ADSL") #> [1] "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL")" get_code(data, dataname = "ADTTE") #> [1] "ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADTTE")" # if you launched the shiny app and pressed the submit button above to load the data, # then these 4 lines do not need to be run adsl$pull() adae$pull() advs$pull() adtte$pull() # get loaded datasets data$get_datasets()  # get single dataset data$get_dataset(dataname = "ADSL")  # get data and dataset connectors data$get_connectors()  # get all datasets/connectors data$get_items()

Sometimes code one object can depend another, case can link way link TealDatasetConnector objects. object code dependent another, ADTTE depends ADSL , get_code return everything need executed reproduce dataset. Using mutate_dataset creates tree calls, can subset dataname, developers can also use mutate_data function doesn‚Äôt require dataname specified. mutate_data used, code single dataset possible subset, instead code datasets returned.
code: adsl <- cdisc_dataset(   dataname = "ADSL",   teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL"),   code = "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = \"ADSL\")" ) %>%   mutate_dataset(code = "ADSL$x1 <- 1") cat(get_code(adsl)) #> ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") #> ADSL$x1 <- 1 data <- cdisc_data(adsl, adtte) %>%   mutate_dataset(code = "ADSL$x3 <- 3", dataname = "ADSL")  # get reproducible code of all datasets cat(get_code(data)) #> ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") #> ADSL$x1 <- 1 #> ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADTTE") #> ADSL$x3 <- 3  # get ADSL reproducible code cat(get_code(data, dataname = "ADSL")) #> ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") #> ADSL$x1 <- 1 #> ADSL$x3 <- 3 data <- mutate_dataset(data, code = "ADTTE$x4 <- 4", dataname = "ADTTE") %>%   mutate_dataset(code = "ADSL <- dplyr::filter(ADSL, SEX == 'F')", dataname = "ADSL")  cat(get_code(data, "ADSL")) #> ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") #> ADSL$x1 <- 1 #> ADSL$x3 <- 3 #> ADSL <- dplyr::filter(ADSL, SEX == "F") # note that the code for ADTTE below does not contain any mention of ADSL cat(get_code(data, "ADTTE")) #> ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADTTE") #> ADTTE$x4 <- 4 data <- mutate_dataset(   data,   code = "ADTTE <- filter(ADTTE, USUBJID %in% ADSL$USUBJID)",   dataname = "ADTTE",   vars = list(ADSL = adsl) # vars = list(<DATANAME> = <dataset name>)) ) %>%   mutate_dataset("ADSL$var_created_after <- NA", dataname = "ADSL")  # note that the code that defines ADSL is now part of the code of ADTTE below cat(get_code(data, dataname = "ADTTE")) #> ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") #> ADSL$x1 <- 1 #> ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADTTE") #> ADSL$x3 <- 3 #> ADTTE$x4 <- 4 #> ADSL <- dplyr::filter(ADSL, SEX == "F") #> ADTTE <- filter(ADTTE, USUBJID %in% ADSL$USUBJID)  # moreover, note that the code inserted to the mutate_dataset after the pipe was not included. data <- mutate_data(data,   code = "     ADSL$x3 <- 3     proxy_var <- 4     ADTTE$x4 <- proxy_var   " )  # single dataset code is not possible to obtain anymore cat(adsl_code <- get_code(data, "ADSL")) #> ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") #> ADSL$x1 <- 1 #> ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADTTE") #> ADSL$x3 <- 3 #> ADTTE$x4 <- 4 #> ADSL <- dplyr::filter(ADSL, SEX == "F") #> ADTTE <- filter(ADTTE, USUBJID %in% ADSL$USUBJID) #> ADSL$var_created_after <- NA #> ADSL$x3 <- 3 #> proxy_var <- 4 #> ADTTE$x4 <- proxy_var cat(adtte_code <- get_code(data, "ADTTE")) #> ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADSL") #> ADSL$x1 <- 1 #> ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname = "ADTTE") #> ADSL$x3 <- 3 #> ADTTE$x4 <- 4 #> ADSL <- dplyr::filter(ADSL, SEX == "F") #> ADTTE <- filter(ADTTE, USUBJID %in% ADSL$USUBJID) #> ADSL$var_created_after <- NA #> ADSL$x3 <- 3 #> proxy_var <- 4 #> ADTTE$x4 <- proxy_var  # TRUE as.character(adsl_code) == as.character(adtte_code) #> [1] TRUE

title: Creating Delayed Data Classes (Advanced)
code: # nolint start library(teal.data) library(magrittr)  slice_example_cdisc_data <- function(dataname, n) {   teal.data::example_cdisc_data(dataname) %>%     head(n) }  adsl <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = callable_function(slice_example_cdisc_data) %>%     set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   label = "ADSL connector" )  adrs <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADRS",   pull_callable = callable_function(slice_example_cdisc_data) %>%     set_args(list(dataname = "ADRS")),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADRS"),   label = "ADRS connector" )  x <- dataset("x", data.frame(x = 1, b = 2), code = "x <- data.frame(x = 1, b = 2)")  data <- teal_data(adsl, adrs, x)  shinyApp(   ui = fluidPage(     shinyjs::useShinyjs(),     titlePanel("Delayed data loading"),     sidebarLayout(       sidebarPanel(data$get_ui("data"), uiOutput("dataset")),       mainPanel(tableOutput("dist_plot"))     )   ),   server = function(input, output, session) {     data_reactive <- data$get_server()("data")     observeEvent(data_reactive(), ignoreNULL = TRUE, {       shinyjs::hide("data-delayed_data")     })     output$dataset <- renderUI({       req(data_reactive())       datanames <- names(get_raw_data(data_reactive()))       radioButtons("dataname", "Select dataname", datanames, datanames[1])     })     output$dist_plot <- renderTable({       req(input$dataname)       dataset <- get_raw_data(data_reactive())[[input$dataname]]       head(dataset)     })   } ) # nolint end

title: Using Delayed Data Loading (Basic)
text: Delayed data objects R objects contain instructions acquire data. practice, pass DDL objects instructions teal application can launch teal app first pull data afterwards. main difference DDL object non-DDL object data available immediately creating non-DDL object. contrast, data DDL object available construction, pulling (executing instructions stored object).

title: Using Delayed Data Loading (Basic)
text: TealDatasetConnector object used pull single delayed data set teal app. Connectors pull data proprietary data storage included package. TealDataConnector object used pull set delayed data sets teal app share common connection (see Delayed Data Loading definition connection object). cdisc_data function takes set TealDataConnector, TealDatasetConnector / cdisc_datasets (non-delayed datasets) create TealData object used create teal applications.
code: # nolint start library(teal.data)  # generalized function to create delayed data from code - see package help for other connectors x <- code_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   code = "library(teal.data)\nADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(\"ADSL\")" ) # nolint end # nolint start library(teal.data) library(magrittr)  adsl <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%     set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   label = "ADSL connector" )  adae <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADAE",   pull_callable = callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%     set_args(list(dataname = "ADAE")),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   label = "ADAE connector" )  adsl_adae <- relational_data_connector(   connection = data_connection(),   connectors = list(adsl, adae) ) # nolint end # nolint start # create a TealDatasetConnector for ADVS library(teal.data) library(magrittr)  advs <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADVS",   pull_callable = callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%     set_args(list(dataname = "ADVS")),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADVS"),   label = "ADVS connector" )  # use cdisc_data() to create a `DDL` object delayed_data <- cdisc_data(adsl_adae, advs) ## Warning: The `data_objects` argument of `cdisc_data()` should use data directly. Using ## TealDatasetConnector and TealDataset is deprecated. as of teal.data 0.3.1. ## This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. ## Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was ## generated. # nolint end

title: Using Delayed Data Loading (Basic)
text: list constructors available teal.data create TealDataset delayed TealDatasetConnector objects: Notes: xyz_dataset_connector functions equivalent xyz_cdisc_dataset_connector function (example rds_cdisc_dataset_connector) specifies additional dataset metadata. cdisc_data standard function used create data object used within teal apps standard CDISC study data. general teal_data function can used allow arbitrary relational data used within teal apps.

title: Using Delayed Data Loading (Basic)
text: datasets passed teal_data cdisc_data pulled order inputted. datasets depend datasets available placed later argument list:
code: # nolint start library(teal.data) library(magrittr)  adsl <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%     set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")),   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   label = "ADSL connector" )  adsl_2 <- code_cdisc_dataset_connector("ADSL_2",   code = "head(ADSL, 5)",   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"), ADSL = adsl )  # launch method will be able to load the data as adsl will be pulled first cdisc_data(adsl, adsl_2) ## A TealData object containing 2 TealDataset/TealDatasetConnector object(s) as element(s): ## --> Element 1: ## A CDISCTealDatasetConnector object, named ADSL, containing a TealDataset object that has not been loaded/pulled ## --> Element 2: ## A CDISCTealDatasetConnector object, named ADSL_2, containing a TealDataset object that has not been loaded/pulled # launch method will not be able to load the data as adae is pulled first but it depends on adsl cdisc_data(adsl_2, adsl) ## A TealData object containing 2 TealDataset/TealDatasetConnector object(s) as element(s): ## --> Element 1: ## A CDISCTealDatasetConnector object, named ADSL_2, containing a TealDataset object that has not been loaded/pulled ## --> Element 2: ## A CDISCTealDatasetConnector object, named ADSL, containing a TealDataset object that has not been loaded/pulled # nolint end

title: Using Delayed Data Loading (Basic)
text: following workflow facilitates building teal apps DDL minimizing debugging overhead. Run teal app configured without delayed data verify app starts expected. Replace cdisc_dataset functions appropriate TealDatasetConnector objects. Add preprocessing code (see Delayed Data Advanced preprocessing documentation) verify running newly created object‚Äôs $launch method. First, include just single module verify teal app starts loads expected data. , add rest modules one one, replacing dataset calls strings iteratively verify app functions expected.

code: adsl_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data)$set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")) adlb_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data)$set_args(list(dataname = "ADLB")) adrs_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data)$set_args(list(dataname = "ADRS")) adtte_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data)$set_args(list(dataname = "ADTTE")) x1 <- cdisc_dataset_connector("ADSL", adsl_cf, keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL")) x2 <- cdisc_dataset_connector("ADRS", adrs_cf, keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADRS")) x3 <- cdisc_dataset(   dataname = "ADAE",   x = teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADAE"),   code = "library(teal.data)\nADAE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(\"ADAE\")" ) x4 <- cdisc_dataset_connector("ADTTE", adtte_cf, keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADTTE")) tc <- teal.data:::TealData$new(x1, x2, x3, x4) tc$get_datanames() #> [1] "ADSL"  "ADRS"  "ADAE"  "ADTTE" if (FALSE) { tc$launch() get_datasets(tc) # equivalent to tc$get_datasets() tc$get_dataset("ADAE") tc$check() }  x <- cdisc_dataset(   dataname = "ADSL",   x = teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL"),   code = "library(teal.data)\nADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(\"ADSL\")" )  x2 <- cdisc_dataset_connector("ADTTE", adtte_cf, keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADTTE")) tc <- teal.data:::TealData$new(x, x2) if (FALSE) { # This errors as we have not pulled the data # tc$get_datasets() # pull the data and then we can get the datasets tc$launch() tc$get_datasets() get_raw_data(tc) }

code: open_fun <- callable_function(data.frame) # define opening function open_fun$set_args(list(x = 1:5)) # define fixed arguments to opening function  close_fun <- callable_function(sum) # define closing function close_fun$set_args(list(x = 1:5)) # define fixed arguments to closing function  ping_fun <- callable_function(function() TRUE)  x <- data_connection( # define connection   ping_fun = ping_fun, # define ping function   open_fun = open_fun, # define opening function   close_fun = close_fun # define closing function )  x$set_open_args(args = list(y = letters[1:5])) # define additional arguments if necessary  x$open() # call opening function x$get_open_call() # check reproducible R code #> [1] "data.frame(x = 1:5, y = c(\"a\", \"b\", \"c\", \"d\", \"e\"))"  # get data from connection via TealDataConnector$get_dataset() if (FALSE) { x$open(args = list(x = 1:5, y = letters[1:5])) # able to call opening function with arguments x$close() # call closing function }

code: library(magrittr)  random_data_connector <- function(dataname) {   fun_dataset_connector(     dataname = dataname,     fun = teal.data::example_cdisc_data,     fun_args = list(dataname = dataname),   ) }  open_fun <- callable_function(library) open_fun$set_args(list(package = "teal.data"))  con <- data_connection(open_fun = open_fun) con$set_open_server(   function(id, connection) {     moduleServer(       id = id,       module = function(input, output, session) {         connection$open(try = TRUE)         return(invisible(connection))       }     )   } )  x <- teal.data:::TealDataConnector$new(   connection = con,   connectors = list(     random_data_connector(dataname = "ADSL"),     random_data_connector(dataname = "ADLB")   ) )  x$set_ui(   function(id, connection, connectors) {     ns <- NS(id)     tagList(       connection$get_open_ui(ns("open_connection")),       numericInput(inputId = ns("n"), label = "Choose number of records", min = 0, value = 1),       do.call(         what = "tagList",         args = lapply(           connectors,           function(connector) {             div(               connector$get_ui(                 id = ns(connector$get_dataname())               ),               br()             )           }         )       )     )   } )  x$set_server(   function(id, connection, connectors) {     moduleServer(       id = id,       module = function(input, output, session) {         # opens connection         connection$get_open_server()(id = "open_connection", connection = connection)         if (connection$is_opened()) {           for (connector in connectors) {             set_args(connector, args = list(n = input$n))             # pull each dataset             connector$get_server()(id = connector$get_dataname())             if (connector$is_failed()) {               break             }           }         }       }     )   } ) if (FALSE) { x$launch() x$get_datasets() }

code: ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `TealDatasetConnector$set_ui_input` ## ------------------------------------------------  ds <- dataset_connector("xyz", pull_callable = callable_function(data.frame)) ds$set_ui_input(   function(ns) {     list(sliderInput(ns("colA"), "Select value for colA", min = 0, max = 10, value = 3),          sliderInput(ns("colB"), "Select value for colB", min = 0, max = 10, value = 7))   } ) if (FALSE) { ds$launch() }  ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `TealDatasetConnector$launch` ## ------------------------------------------------  ds <- dataset_connector("xyz", pull_callable = callable_function(data.frame)) ds$set_ui_input(   function(ns) {     list(sliderInput(ns("colA"), "Select value for colA", min = 0, max = 10, value = 3),          sliderInput(ns("colB"), "Select value for colB", min = 0, max = 10, value = 7))   } ) if (FALSE) { ds$launch() }

title: Data input for teal app ‚Äî cdisc_data
text: ... (TealDataConnector, TealDataset, TealDatasetConnector, ) one Teal* objects provided, function returns TealData object. way specifying data deprecated removed next release. version 0.4.0, one can provide object named argument function return teal_data object. Objects provided ... stored teal_data environment name argument name. join_keys (JoinKeys) single (JoinKeySet) (optional) object datasets column names used joining. empty automatically derived basing intersection datasets primary keys. ADAM datasets automatically derived. code (character) code reproduce datasets. check (logical) reproducibility check - whether perform check pre-processing code included object definitions actually produces objects. check true preprocessing code empty error thrown.

title: The constructor of CDISCTealDataConnector objects. ‚Äî cdisc_data_connector
The constructor of CDISCTealDataConnector objects. ‚Äî cdisc_data_connector
code: adsl_cf <- callable_function(   function() as.data.frame(as.list(setNames(nm = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL")))) ) adae_cf <- callable_function(   function() as.data.frame(as.list(setNames(nm = get_cdisc_keys("ADAE")))) ) adsl <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   "ADSL", adsl_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"), parent = character(0) ) adae <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   "ADAE", adae_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADAE"), parent = "ADSL" ) data <- cdisc_data_connector(   connection = data_connection(open_fun = callable_function(function() "open function")),   connectors = list(adsl, adae) )

what: Create a new object of CDISCTealDataset class ‚Äî cdisc_dataset
title: Create a new object of CDISCTealDataset class ‚Äî cdisc_dataset
Create a new object of CDISCTealDataset class ‚Äî cdisc_dataset
code: cdisc_dataset(   dataname,   x,   keys = get_cdisc_keys(dataname),   parent = if (identical(dataname, "ADSL")) character(0) else "ADSL",   label = data_label(x),   code = character(0),   vars = list(),   metadata = NULL )

title: Create a new object of CDISCTealDataset class ‚Äî cdisc_dataset
text: dataname (character) given name dataset, contain spaces x (data.frame MultiAssayExperiment) object dataset created keys optional, (character) vector primary keys parent (character, optional) parent dataset name label (character) label describe dataset code (character) character string defining code needed produce data set x vars (named list) case object code depends TealDataset object(s) constant value, /object(s) included named element(s) list. example object code needs ADSL object specify vars = list(ADSL = <adsl object>). recommended include TealDataset TealDatasetConnector objects vars list preserve reproducibility. Please note vars included object local vars modified within another dataset. metadata (named list NULL) field containing metadata dataset. element list atomic length one.

code: open_fun <- callable_function(data.frame) # define opening function open_fun$set_args(list(x = 1:5)) # define fixed arguments to opening function  close_fun <- callable_function(sum) # define closing function close_fun$set_args(list(x = 1:5)) # define fixed arguments to closing function  ping_fun <- callable_function(function() TRUE)  x <- data_connection( # define connection   ping_fun = ping_fun, # define ping function   open_fun = open_fun, # define opening function   close_fun = close_fun # define closing function )  x$set_open_args(args = list(y = letters[1:5])) # define additional arguments if necessary  x$open() # call opening function x$get_open_call() # check reproducible R code #> [1] "data.frame(x = 1:5, y = c(\"a\", \"b\", \"c\", \"d\", \"e\"))"  # get data from connection via TealDataConnector$get_dataset() if (FALSE) { x$open(args = list(x = 1:5, y = letters[1:5])) # able to call opening function with arguments x$close() # call closing function }

Load TealDataset object from a file ‚Äî dataset_file
code: # simple example file_example <- tempfile(fileext = ".R") writeLines(   text = c(     "library(teal.data)      dataset(dataname = \"iris\",              x = iris,              code = \"iris\")"   ),   con = file_example ) x <- dataset_file(file_example, code = character(0)) get_code(x) #> [1] "iris"  # custom code file_example <- tempfile(fileext = ".R") writeLines(   text = c(     "library(teal.data)       # code>      x <- iris      x$a1 <- 1      x$a2 <- 2       # <code      dataset(dataname = \"iris_mod\", x = x)"   ),   con = file_example ) x <- dataset_file(file_example) get_code(x) #> [1] "x <- iris\nx$a1 <- 1\nx$a2 <- 2"

Function Dataset Connector ‚Äî fun_dataset_connector
code: fun_dataset_connector(   dataname,   fun,   fun_args = NULL,   keys = character(0),   label = character(0),   code = character(0),   script = character(0),   func_name = substitute(fun),   metadata = NULL,   ... )  fun_cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname,   fun,   fun_args = NULL,   keys = get_cdisc_keys(dataname),   parent = if (identical(dataname, "ADSL")) character(0L) else "ADSL",   label = character(0),   code = character(0),   script = character(0),   func_name = substitute(fun),   metadata = NULL,   ... )

title: Function Dataset Connector ‚Äî fun_dataset_connector
text: dataname (character) given name dataset may contain spaces fun (function) custom function obtain dataset. fun_args (list) additional arguments (func). keys optional, (character) vector dataset primary keys column names label (character) Label describe dataset. code (character) character string defining code modify raw_data dataset. modify current dataset code contain least one assignment object defined dataname argument. example dataname = ADSL example code contain ADSL <- <R code>. used simultaneously script script (character) Alternatively code - location file containing modification code. used simultaneously script. func_name (name) internal purposes, please keep default metadata (named list, NULL CallableFunction)  Field containing either metadata dataset (element list atomic length one) CallableFuntion pull metadata connection. return list object can converted list .list. ... Additional arguments applied pull function. case object code depends raw_data TealDataset, TealDatasetConnector object(s) constant value, /object(s) included. Please note vars included object local vars modified within another dataset. parent (character, optional) parent dataset name

title: Function Dataset Connector ‚Äî fun_dataset_connector

title: Get code ‚Äî get_code
text: x (TealDatasetConnector TealDataset). class character treated file read. ... used, support S3 deparse (logical) whether return deparsed form call dataname (character) Name dataset return code . exclude_comments (logical) whether exclude commented-lines code. Lines excluded ended # nocode. multiple line exclusions one enclose ignored block code # nocode> # <nocode read_sources (logical) whether replace source("path") code lines sourced file. read_sources = TRUE changing working directory inside preprocessing allowed. files_path (character) (optional) vector files path read preprocessing. Code multiple files joined together.

title: Get code ‚Äî get_code
code: x1 <- dataset(   x = data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c("a", "b"), stringsAsFactors = FALSE),   keys = "y",   dataname = "XY",   code = "XY <- data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c('aa', 'bb'), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)",   label = character(0) )  x2 <- dataset(   x = data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c("a", "b"), stringsAsFactors = FALSE),   keys = "y",   dataname = "XYZ",   code = "XYZ <- data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c('aa', 'bb'), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)",   label = character(0) )  rd <- teal_data(x1, x2)  get_code(rd) #> [1] "XY <- data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c(\"aa\", \"bb\"), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)\nXYZ <- data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c(\"aa\", \"bb\"), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)" get_code(rd, "XY") #> [1] "XY <- data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c(\"aa\", \"bb\"), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)" get_code(rd, "XYZ") #> [1] "XYZ <- data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c(\"aa\", \"bb\"), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)"

TealDataConnector -------- library(magrittr)  slice_cdisc_data <- function(dataname, n) {   head(example_cdisc_data(dataname), n) }  random_data_connector <- function(dataname) {   fun_dataset_connector(     dataname = dataname,     fun = slice_cdisc_data,     fun_args = list(dataname = dataname),   ) }  open_fun <- callable_function(library) open_fun$set_args(list(package = "teal.data"))  con <- data_connection(open_fun = open_fun) con$set_open_server(   function(id, connection) {     moduleServer(       id = id,       module = function(input, output, session) {         connection$open(try = TRUE)         return(invisible(connection))       }     )   } )  rdc <- relational_data_connector(   connection = con,   connectors = list(random_data_connector("ADSL"), random_data_connector("ADLB")) )  rdc$set_ui(   function(id, connection, connectors) {     ns <- NS(id)     tagList(       connection$get_open_ui(ns("open_connection")),       numericInput(inputId = ns("n"), label = "Choose number of records", min = 0, value = 1),       do.call(         what = "tagList",         args = lapply(           connectors,           function(connector) {             div(               connector$get_ui(                 id = ns(connector$get_dataname())               ),               br()             )           }         )       )     )   } )  rdc$set_server(   function(id, connection, connectors) {     moduleServer(       id = id,       module = function(input, output, session) {         # opens connection         connection$get_open_server()(id = "open_connection", connection = connection)         if (connection$is_opened()) {           for (connector in connectors) {             set_args(connector, args = list(n = input$n))             # pull each dataset             connector$get_server()(id = connector$get_dataname())             if (connector$is_failed()) {               break             }           }         }       }     )   } )  if (FALSE) { load_datasets(rdc) get_raw_data(rdc) }  # TealData (with connectors) -------- drc <- cdisc_data(rdc) if (FALSE) { get_raw_data(drc) }

code: # TealDatasetConnector -------- library(magrittr) pull_fun_adsl <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")) x <- dataset_connector("ADSL", pull_fun_adsl)  is_pulled(x) #> [1] FALSE  load_dataset(x) is_pulled(x) #> [1] TRUE # TealDataset -------- x <- dataset(   dataname = "XY",   x = data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c("a", "b"), stringsAsFactors = FALSE),   keys = "y",   code = "XY <- data.frame(x = c(1, 2), y = c('aa', 'bb'),                            stringsAsFactors = FALSE)" )  is_pulled(x) #> [1] TRUE  library(magrittr)  # TealData -------- x1 <- dataset(   x = teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL"),   dataname = "ADSL",   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   code = "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(\"ADSL\")",   label = "ADTTE dataset" )  x2 <- dataset(   x = teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADTTE"),   dataname = "ADTTE",   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADTTE"),   code = "ADTTE <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(\"ADTTE\")",   label = "ADTTE dataset" )  rd <- teal_data(x1, x2) is_pulled(rd) #> [1] TRUE  # TealDataConnector -------- adsl_cf <- callable_function(teal.data::example_cdisc_data) %>%   set_args(list(dataname = "ADSL")) adsl <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "ADSL",   pull_callable = adsl_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL") )  new_cf <- callable_function(function(x) {   x$NEW <- 1:nrow(x)   x }) new_cf$set_args(list(x = as.name("x"))) new <- cdisc_dataset_connector(   dataname = "NEW",   pull_callable = new_cf,   keys = get_cdisc_keys("ADSL"),   vars = list(x = adsl) )  rdc <- cdisc_data(adsl, new)  is_pulled(rdc) #> [1] FALSE if (FALSE) { load_datasets(rdc) is_pulled(rdc) }

title: Create a relationship between a pair of datasets ‚Äî join_key
Create a relationship between a pair of datasets ‚Äî join_key
text: dataset_1 (character) one dataset name dataset_2 (character) dataset name keys (optionally named character) names(keys) columns dataset_1 relationship columns dataset_2 given elements keys. names(keys) NULL column names used dataset_1 dataset_2.

title: Create a relationship between a pair of datasets ‚Äî join_key
text: object class JoinKeySet passed join_keys function.

title: Create a JoinKeys out of a list of JoinKeySet objects ‚Äî join_keys
Create a JoinKeys out of a list of JoinKeySet objects ‚Äî join_keys
text: ... optional, JoinKeySet objects created using join_key function.

title: Create a JoinKeys out of a list of JoinKeySet objects ‚Äî join_keys
Create a JoinKeys out of a list of JoinKeySet objects ‚Äî join_keys
text: Note join keys symmetric although relationship needs specified .

title: Create a JoinKeys out of a list of JoinKeySet objects ‚Äî join_keys
code: join_keys() #> An empty JoinKeys object. join_keys(   join_key("dataset_A", "dataset_B", c("col_1" = "col_a")),   join_key("dataset_A", "dataset_C", c("col_2" = "col_x", "col_3" = "col_y")) ) #> A JoinKeys object containing foreign keys between 3 datasets: #> $dataset_A #> $dataset_A$dataset_B #>   col_1  #> "col_a"  #>  #> $dataset_A$dataset_C #>   col_2   col_3  #> "col_x" "col_y"  #>  #>  #> $dataset_B #> $dataset_B$dataset_A #>   col_a  #> "col_1"  #>  #>  #> $dataset_C #> $dataset_C$dataset_A #>   col_x   col_y  #> "col_2" "col_3"  #>  #>  join_keys(   join_key("dataset_A", "dataset_B", c("col_1" = "col_a")) ) #> A JoinKeys object containing foreign keys between 2 datasets: #> $dataset_A #> $dataset_A$dataset_B #>   col_1  #> "col_a"  #>  #>  #> $dataset_B #> $dataset_B$dataset_A #>   col_a  #> "col_1"  #>  #>

title: The constructor of MAETealDataset ‚Äî mae_dataset
code: mae_dataset(   dataname,   x,   label = data_label(x),   code = character(0),   vars = list() )

title: The constructor of MAETealDataset ‚Äî mae_dataset
text: dataname (character) given name dataset, contain spaces x (MultiAssayExperiment) label (character) label describe dataset code (character) character string defining code needed produce data set x vars (named list) case object code depends TealDataset object(s) constant value, /object(s) included named element(s) list. example object code needs ADSL object specify vars = list(ADSL = <adsl object>). recommended include TealDataset TealDatasetConnector objects vars list preserve reproducibility. Please note vars included object local vars modified within another dataset.

title: The constructor of MAETealDataset ‚Äî mae_dataset
code: # Simple example utils::data(miniACC, package = "MultiAssayExperiment") mae_d <- dataset("MAE", miniACC) mae_d$get_dataname() #> [1] "MAE" mae_d$get_dataset_label() #> character(0) mae_d$get_code() #> [1] "" mae_d$get_raw_data() #> A MultiAssayExperiment object of 5 listed #>  experiments with user-defined names and respective classes. #>  Containing an ExperimentList class object of length 5: #>  [1] RNASeq2GeneNorm: SummarizedExperiment with 198 rows and 79 columns #>  [2] gistict: SummarizedExperiment with 198 rows and 90 columns #>  [3] RPPAArray: SummarizedExperiment with 33 rows and 46 columns #>  [4] Mutations: matrix with 97 rows and 90 columns #>  [5] miRNASeqGene: SummarizedExperiment with 471 rows and 80 columns #> Functionality: #>  experiments() - obtain the ExperimentList instance #>  colData() - the primary/phenotype DataFrame #>  sampleMap() - the sample coordination DataFrame #>  `$`, `[`, `[[` - extract colData columns, subset, or experiment #>  *Format() - convert into a long or wide DataFrame #>  assays() - convert ExperimentList to a SimpleList of matrices #>  exportClass() - save data to flat files

title: Mutate data by code ‚Äî mutate_data
text: Code used mutation linked particular refers datasets. Consequence using get_code(<dataset>) part code returned dataset specified. method used particular call involve changing multiple datasets. Otherwise please use mutate_dataset. Execution code delayed datasets pulled (isTRUE(is_pulled)).

title: Mutate data by code ‚Äî mutate_data
code: mutate_data(x, code = character(0), script = character(0), vars = list())  # S3 method for TealDataAbstract mutate_data(x, code = character(0), script = character(0), vars = list())

title: Mutate data by code ‚Äî mutate_data
text: x (TealDataAbstract) object. code (character) Code mutate dataset. Must contain dataset$dataname. can also object class PythonCodeClass returned python_code. script (character) file contains R Code can read using read_script. Preferred code argument. vars (named list))  case object code depends TealDataset object(s) constant value, /object(s) included named element(s) list. example object code needs ADSL object specify vars = list(ADSL = <adsl object>). recommended include TealDataset TealDatasetConnector objects vars list preserve reproducibility. Please note vars included object local vars modified within another dataset.

title: Mutate data by code ‚Äî mutate_data
Mutate dataset by code ‚Äî mutate_dataset
code: mutate_dataset(x, ...)  # S3 method for TealDataset mutate_dataset(   x,   code = character(0),   script = character(0),   vars = list(),   ... )  # S3 method for TealDatasetConnector mutate_dataset(   x,   code = character(0),   script = character(0),   vars = list(),   ... )  # S3 method for TealDataAbstract mutate_dataset(   x,   dataname,   code = character(0),   script = character(0),   vars = list(),   ... )

title: Mutate dataset by code ‚Äî mutate_dataset
text: x (TealDataset) object. ... used, support S3 code (character) Code mutate dataset. Must contain dataset$dataname. can also object class PythonCodeClass returned python_code. script (character) file contains R Code can read using read_script. Preferred code argument. vars (named list))  case object code depends TealDataset object(s) constant value, /object(s) included named element(s) list. example object code needs ADSL object specify vars = list(ADSL = <adsl object>). recommended include TealDataset TealDatasetConnector objects vars list preserve reproducibility. Please note vars included object local vars modified within another dataset. dataname (character)Dataname mutated.

title: Mutate dataset by code ‚Äî mutate_dataset
Mutate dataset by code ‚Äî mutate_dataset
code: library(magrittr)  ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL")  ADSL_dataset <- dataset(   dataname = "ADSL",   x = ADSL,   label = "AdAM subject-level dataset",   code = "ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data(\"ADSL\")" ) ADSL_mutated <- ADSL_dataset %>%   mutate_dataset(code = "ADSL$new_variable <- 1")  ADSL_mutated$get_raw_data()$new_variable[1] #> [1] 1  # Use an R script to mutate the data file_example <- tempfile(fileext = ".R") writeLines(   text = c(     "ADSL <- ADSL %>%       dplyr::mutate(new_variable = new_variable * 2)"   ),   con = file_example )  ADSL_mutated <- ADSL_mutated %>%   mutate_dataset(script = file_example)  ADSL_mutated$get_raw_data()$new_variable[1] #> [1] 2  ADSL_mutated <- ADSL_mutated %>%   mutate_dataset(code = read_script(file_example))  ADSL_mutated$get_raw_data()$new_variable[1] #> [1] 4

what: Mutate JoinKeys with a new values ‚Äî mutate_join_keys
title: Mutate JoinKeys with a new values ‚Äî mutate_join_keys
Mutate JoinKeys with a new values ‚Äî mutate_join_keys
code: mutate_join_keys(x, dataset_1, dataset_2, val)  # S3 method for JoinKeys mutate_join_keys(x, dataset_1, dataset_2, val)  # S3 method for TealData mutate_join_keys(x, dataset_1, dataset_2, val)

title: Mutate JoinKeys with a new values ‚Äî mutate_join_keys
text: x (JoinKeys) object modified dataset_1 (character) one dataset name dataset_2 (character) dataset name val (named character) column names used join

title: Mutate JoinKeys with a new values ‚Äî mutate_join_keys
Mutate JoinKeys with a new values ‚Äî mutate_join_keys
code: # JoinKeys ----  x <- join_keys(   join_key("dataset_A", "dataset_B", c("col_1" = "col_a")),   join_key("dataset_A", "dataset_C", c("col_2" = "col_x", "col_3" = "col_y")) ) x$get("dataset_A", "dataset_B") #>   col_1  #> "col_a"   mutate_join_keys(x, "dataset_A", "dataset_B", c("col_1" = "col_10")) x$get("dataset_A", "dataset_B") #>    col_1  #> "col_10"  # TealData ----  ADSL <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADSL") ADRS <- teal.data::example_cdisc_data("ADRS")  x <- cdisc_data(   cdisc_dataset("ADSL", ADSL),   cdisc_dataset("ADRS", ADRS) ) x$get_join_keys()$get("ADSL", "ADRS") #>   STUDYID   USUBJID  #> "STUDYID" "USUBJID"   mutate_join_keys(x, "ADSL", "ADRS", c("COLUMN1" = "COLUMN2")) x$get_join_keys()$get("ADSL", "ADRS") #>   COLUMN1  #> "COLUMN2"

title: Initialize teal_data object ‚Äî new_teal_data
Initialize teal_data object ‚Äî new_teal_data
code: new_teal_data(   data,   code = character(0),   keys = join_keys(),   datanames = names(data) )

title: Initialize teal_data object ‚Äî new_teal_data
text: data (named list) List data. code (character(1) language) code evaluate. Accepts stores comments also. keys (JoinKeys) object datanames (character) names datasets passed data. Needed non-dataset objects needed env slot.

title: Python Code ‚Äî python_code
code: if (FALSE) { library(reticulate) library(magrittr)  # mutate dataset object  random_data_connector <- function(dataname) {   fun_dataset_connector(     dataname = dataname,     fun = teal.data::example_cdisc_data,     fun_args = list(dataname = dataname),   ) } x <- random_data_connector(dataname = "ADSL")  x %>% mutate_dataset(python_code("import pandas as pd r.ADSL = pd.DataFrame({'x': [1]})"))  x$get_code() x$pull() x$get_raw_data()  # mutate data object  y <- 8 tc <- cdisc_data(   random_data_connector(dataname = "ADSL"),   random_data_connector(dataname = "ADLB") )  tc %>% mutate_data(python_code("import pandas as pd r.ADSL = pd.DataFrame({'STUDYID': [r.y], 'USUBJID': [r.y]})"), vars = list(y = y))   load_datasets(tc) # submit all ds <- tc$get_dataset("ADSL") ds$get_raw_data() }

title: Python TealDatasetConnector ‚Äî python_dataset_connector
text: dataname (character) given name dataset may contain spaces file (character) Path file location containing python script used generate object. code (character) string containing python code run using reticulate. Carefully consider indentation follow proper python syntax. object (character) name object python script assigned dataset used. keys optional, (character) vector dataset primary keys column names label (character) Label describe dataset. mutate_code (character) String containing code used mutate object produced. mutate_script (character) Alternatively mutate_code - location file containing modification code. used simultaneously mutate_script. vars (named list))  case object code depends TealDataset object(s) constant value, /object(s) included named element(s) list. example object code needs ADSL object specify vars = list(ADSL = <adsl object>). recommended include TealDataset TealDatasetConnector objects vars list preserve reproducibility. Please note vars included object local vars modified within another dataset. metadata (named list, NULL CallableFunction)  Field containing either metadata dataset (element list atomic length one) CallableFuntion pull metadata connection. return list object can converted list .list. parent (character, optional) parent dataset name

title: The constructor for TealDataConnector class. ‚Äî relational_data_connector
The constructor for TealDataConnector class. ‚Äî relational_data_connector
code: library(magrittr) random_data_connector <- function(dataname) {   fun_dataset_connector(     dataname = dataname,     fun = teal.data::example_cdisc_data,     fun_args = list(dataname = dataname),   ) }  open_fun <- callable_function(library) open_fun$set_args(list(package = "teal.data"))  con <- data_connection(open_fun = open_fun) con$set_open_server(   function(id, connection) {     moduleServer(       id = id,       module = function(input, output, session) {         connection$open(try = TRUE)         return(invisible(connection))       }     )   } )  x <- relational_data_connector(   connection = con,   connectors = list(     random_data_connector(dataname = "ADSL"),     random_data_connector(dataname = "ADLB")   ) )  x$set_ui(   function(id, connection, connectors) {     ns <- NS(id)     tagList(       connection$get_open_ui(ns("open_connection")),       numericInput(inputId = ns("n"), label = "Choose number of records", min = 0, value = 1),       do.call(         what = "tagList",         args = lapply(           connectors,           function(connector) {             div(               connector$get_ui(                 id = ns(connector$get_dataname())               ),               br()             )           }         )       )     )   } )  x$set_server(   function(id, connection, connectors) {     moduleServer(       id = id,       module = function(input, output, session) {         # opens connection         connection$get_open_server()(id = "open_connection", connection = connection)         if (connection$is_opened()) {           for (connector in connectors) {             set_args(connector, args = list(n = input$n))             # pull each dataset             connector$get_server()(id = connector$get_dataname())             if (connector$is_failed()) {               break             }           }         }       }     )   } ) if (FALSE) { x$launch() x$get_datasets() }

title: teal.data 0.3.0.9007
text: Introduced new data class (teal_data) replaces deprecated TealData. New data class becomes standard input whole teal framework. Deprecated teal_data constructor TealDataset, TealDatasetConnector TealDataConnector objects provided. New delayed data loading functions introduced teal package.
